title: Email SPF Policy Checker
description: Check SPF (Sender Policy Framework) records for email authentication and deliverability. Analyze which servers are authorized to send email for your domain and assess delivery risk.

domain.label: Domain Name
domain.tooltip: Enter the domain to check SPF policy for

deliverability.title: Email Deliverability Risk
deliverability.low: Strong SPF policy with hard fail - excellent email security
deliverability.medium: Moderate SPF policy with soft fail - good but could be stronger
deliverability.high: Weak or missing SPF policy - high risk of email spoofing

hardFail.label: Hard Fail (-all)
hardFail.disabledDesc: Consider upgrading to -all for better security

allowsAll.label: Allows All (+all)
allowsAll.warning: WARNING: Any server can send email for this domain

lookupLimitExceeded.title: DNS Lookup Limit Exceeded
lookupLimitExceeded.message: This SPF record requires {count} DNS lookups, which exceeds the RFC limit of 10. This may cause delivery failures.

highLookupCount.title: High DNS Lookup Count
highLookupCount.message: This SPF record requires {count} DNS lookups. Consider optimizing to stay well below the 10-lookup limit.

mechanisms.aRecordDomain: A record lookup for domain itself
mechanisms.mxRecordDomain: MX record lookup for domain itself
mechanisms.softFail: Soft fail - mark unauthorized emails as suspicious

noRecord.title: No SPF Record Found
noRecord.message: Domain {domain} does not have an SPF record configured.
noRecord.warning: This means anyone can send email claiming to be from this domain, significantly increasing spoofing risk.

mechanisms.title: SPF Mechanisms
mechanisms.ip: Authorize specific IP addresses or networks
mechanisms.amx: Authorize servers from A or MX records

deliverability.title: Email Deliverability
deliverability.noSpf: High spoofing risk, may affect deliverability

bestPractices.title: Best Practices
bestPractices.useHardFail: Use -all for hard fail when possible
bestPractices.monitorDelivery: Monitor email delivery after SPF changes

examples.title: Common SPF Examples
examples.googleWorkspace: Use Google Workspace with soft fail
examples.specificIp: Only allow specific IP with hard fail
examples.aMxRecords: Allow A and MX record servers with hard fail
